text: Honored guests.

HBS students who will soon
become the newest HBS alums.
Woo-hoo.

HBS faculty and staff, welcome
to the diploma ceremony
of the great HBS class of 2022.
[APPLAUSE]

I'm Jan Rivkin, faculty
chair of the MBA program.

And I'm Jana Kierstead,
executive director of the MBA
and doctoral programs.
And together we're Jan and Jana.
[APPLAUSE]

The two of us feel
deeply privileged to open
this wonderful event.

The first in-person diplomacy
ceremony at HBS in three years.
Woo-hoo.
So much better than Zoom.
So much better than Zoom.

This is a day we have
been waiting for,

hoping for, planning for, and
dreaming about for a long time.

We have a few words for our
MBA and doctoral graduates

and then a few
words for our dean.
First to our graduates.

Dear graduates,
who has your back?

At your back, right
behind you literally today

and figuratively every day
you have an incredible set
of supporters.

Mom, dads, grandparents,
step parents, aunts, uncles,

siblings, partners,
kids, friends, family.

People here in person today
and people here only in spirit.

Many of these individuals
were your earliest investors.

They were in before the A
round, your angel investors.

And I promise you,
there were a few moments

along the way where the
investment looked a little bit
iffy but they stuck with you.

Many of them carried you
in their arms in the past,

all of them carry you in their
hearts today and every day.

We want to invite our
graduates and here we're

encouraging a little
bit of rowdiness please.

We want to invite you to
stand up, turn back, face

your supporters, and thank them
with a huge round of applause.
[APPLAUSE]

That energy and
enthusiasm tells you

much of what you need
to know about the HBS
MBA and doctoral class of 2022.

This is a class that had the
fortitude and flexibility
to navigate HBS in a pandemic.

MBA students, you
took a leap of faith

with us, accepting
your admissions

offers in the
spring of 2020 when

no one knew what the pandemic
HBS experience would be.

And the experience
was hard at times.

But you stuck with
it and with us.

Through Zoom school, lockdown,
circuit breakers, gathering
size limits, dimmer switches.

You immersed yourselves
in MBA classes

and doctoral seminars,
even the ones
you attended in your pajamas.

You immersed yourselves in MBA
classes and oh-- that's you,
sorry.
However--
We kind of mix these things up.
It's true.

You worked with us and the rest
of the HBS staff and faculty

team until the classrooms
were finally full again.

We know we didn't
always get it right,

but we hope you know we
always tried our hardest

and did our best with the whole
community's interests at heart.

And as all of us work
together to fight the virus,

we grew to have deep,
enormous admiration
and affection for you.

And together we've arrived
with the special day,

this beautiful day,
when we offer you
our deepest congratulations.
